title: War in Ukraine: How Russia adapted its winter strategy
summary: Moscow's forces have adapted their tactics since last winter, preceding their missiles with waves of drones, whose mission is to saturate Kyiv's air defense capabilities and deplete their ammunition reserves.

title: Assassination of a Hamas leader in Beirut sparks fears of regional conflict
summary: A drone strike attributed to Israel targeted the deputy chairman of Hamas' political bureau, Saleh al-Arouri. He had been living in exile in a Hezbollah stronghold within Beirut.

title: Iran says at least 103 people killed in blasts at ceremony honoring slain general Soleimani
summary: Two deadly blasts occurred near the grave of Revolutionary Guards general Qassem Soleimani, Iranian state television said Wednesday.

title: Tortured migrants cared for at Palermo hospital
summary: A specialized medical service is helping asylum seekers who have fallen into the hands of traffickers on their way to Europe.

title: French cinema split over the case of Gérard Depardieu
summary: Many letters and op-eds exposed a major split in French cinema about the case of the actor, a film icon now charged with rape and sexual assault.

title: Manchester United co-owner billionaire Jim Ratcliffe's insatiable appetite for sport
summary: Having acquired a quarter of the famous soccer club, the British businessman continues his expansion, from sailing to cycling and marathon running.

title: Storm Henk causes flooding and travel disruption in UK
summary: Hundreds of flood warnings were in place after strong winds and rain lashed large parts of the country, hitting travel and cutting power.

title: Republicans claim victory after resignation of Harvard president Claudine Gay
summary: Criticized for her answers on anti-Semitism at a Congressional hearing after Hamas's attacks on Israel, the first Black president of the prestigious institution was also accused of plagiarism in her doctoral thesis.

title: Yotam Ottolenghi: 'A cuisine is never static'
summary: The British-Israeli chef, head of seven establishments in London, plans to open a deli restaurant in Paris. His bestseller 'Jerusalem' is an ode to mixed-race cuisine co-written with Palestinian Sami Tamimi.

title: Death toll in Japan earthquake rises to 62 as weather hinders rescue effort
summary: Nearly 32,000 people are in shelters as heavy rain threatens the area.

title: Argentina arrests suspected Yemen-linked 'terrorist cell'
summary: The three foreigners, citizens of Syria and Lebanon, were arrested by Argentina's federal police under suspicions of planning a 'terrorist act,' as the country hosts a pan-American Jewish sporting event.

title: English doctors begin longest-ever NHS strike
summary: Junior doctors in England have begun a six-day walkout, the longest consecutive strike in the National Health Service's history, citing uneven pay rises between doctor grades, meaning 'pay cuts for many doctors.'

title: US-led multi-national force faces Houthi attacks in Red Sea
summary: Iran has deployed a warship in the wake of a deadly confrontation between the US military and Yemeni rebels in what is a vital shipping route for global commerce.

title: Cryptocurrency: After a year of scandals and ups and downs, the appetite for bitcoin is growing
summary: The main cryptoassets have seen their prices rebound in recent months, starting with bitcoin, which is in the process of being selected as an investment vehicle by world-class asset managers.

title: 'Priscilla': Portrait of a young girl under the influence of Elvis Presley
summary: Sofia Coppola weaves the story of a teenage girl locked in a gilded cage by an abusive star.

title: Trump appeals Maine primary ballot ban
summary: Maine has joined Colorado in barring Trump from appearing on the primary ballot because of his role in the January 6, 2021 assault on the US Capitol.

title: Sports betting fever sweeps Africa
summary: Online gambling is flourishing on the continent that is home to the world's youngest population. The social consequences that accompany the phenomenon can be detrimental.

title: Hospitals in Lebanon on alert over risk of war
summary: The country's Health Ministry reactivated an emergency plan to prepare hospitals in the event of escalation, after weeks of clashes on the Lebanese-Israeli border.
